p: Kimura's disease is rare and is mainly diagnosed based on histological examination, as well as physical and radiological examination. Outcome is significantly better after systemic therapy. In the present case, although no recurrence was noted during the 10-month follow-up period, further monitoring is required. Our study demonstrates that a painless nasal forehead mass should be excluded from Kimura's disease and nasal forehead Kimura's disease has a good outcome after surgery and prednisone treatment without radiotherapy.
